text: This article contains a list of notable websites that use a wiki model. These websites will sometimes use different software in order to provide the best content management system for their users' needs, though they all share the same basic editing and viewing website model. ==Table== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! scope="col" | Name ! scope="col" | Focus ! scope="col" | Notes ! scope="col" | Entries ! scope="col" | License |- | AboutUs.com | Internet directory | Initially pre-populated with information about many different websites. Uses MediaWiki software, but now largely with Ruby on Rails | style="text-align: right" | | GFDL and CC BY-SA |- | ArchWiki | Computers (Linux) | Wiki about Arch Linux and various software for it. | style="text- align: right" | | GNU Free Documentation License 1.3 or later |- |Appropedia |Poverty reduction, international development | | |Creative Commons license |- | Astrodatabank | Encyclopedic | Astrological wiki project, with birth details for notable people of the world. | style="text-align: right" | |- | Baidu Baike | Encyclopedic/Simplified Chinese | Simplified Chinese encyclopedia | style="text-align: right" | | Copyrighted |- | Baike.com | Encyclopedic/Simplified Chinese | Simplified Chinese encyclopedia | style="text-align: right" | | Copyrighted |- | Base de datos | Encyclopedic/Spanish | Spanish language encyclopedia, with own wiki software. | style="text-align: right" | | Copyrighted/Other |- | Catawiki | Catalogues | Originally in Dutch, with English version. Collectors specific for comics, coins, stamps, trading cards, board games, model cars, model trains, bank notes, books, watches, Disney memorabilia, clocks and other. | style="text- align: right" | |- | Citizendium | Encyclopedic | Requires writers to use real names rather than usernames; guided by expert input while allowing edits from the general public | style="text-align: right" | | CC BY-SA 3.0 |- | Conservapedia | Encyclopedic | Information and articles are written from a Conservative Christian viewpoint aimed at correcting the alleged liberal bias of Wikipedia. | style="text-align: right" | | Copyrighted (free use) |- |Copyright Evidence |Copyright studies |Exists to inform public debate and policy development on copyright related issues based on categorising empirical studies. Funded and maintained by CREATe at the University of Glasgow. | style="text-align: right" | |- | Choral Public Domain Library (CPDL) | Music | Wiki library of free typeset musical scores | style="text-align: right" | | Public domain, CPDL Licence, C.C. Licences, Copyrighted (free use) |- | DavisWiki | Place – Davis, California | City wiki dedicated solely to Davis; at one point the largest city wiki | style="text-align: right" | | CC BY 3.0 |- | Diplopedia | Government – Diplomacy | Encyclopedia of the U.S. Department of State collecting items related to international relations and diplomacy |- | EcuRed | Cuban perspective on global issues, in Spanish | Run by Cuba's Youth Computer Club, an affiliate of the Communist Youth Union | style="text- align: right" | | CC BY-NC-SA. |- | Enciclopedia Libre Universal en Español | Encyclopedic/Spanish | Spanish language fork of Wikipedia | style="text-align: right" | | CC BY-SA 3.0 |- | Encyclopedia of Mathematics | Mathematics | MediaWiki using MathJax extension | style="text-align: right" | | CC BY-SA 3.0 |- | Encyclopedia Dramatica | Parody of Internet memes | Parody-themed wiki | style="text-align: right" | | Fair use |- | Everipedia | Encyclopedic | | style="text-align: right" | | CC BY-SA 4.0 |- | Fallout Wiki | Fiction/Gaming – Fallout series | Wiki about the Fallout video game series. title: List of wikis
